title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics are 35-19, ranked second in the Eastern Conference entering the All-Star break.
Jaylen Brown scores 29.3 points per game, leading to his first All-Star starter selection.
Celtics struggle in close games, with a 12-14 record in clutch situations, ranked 21st in the league.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter activities at museums like the Sandwich Glass Museum and the JFK Hyannis Museum.
Outdoor enthusiasts can enjoy hiking and snowshoeing at locations such as the Cape Cod Rail Trail and Nickerson State Park.
Visitors can explore local eateries and breweries including Bamboo Chinese Cuisine, Devil's Purse Brewing Company, and Truro Vineyards.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, a 30-year-old from Fuquay-Varina, NC, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Breakthrough T1D.
Lapczynski, who has Type 1 Diabetes, previously lived in Boston and studied at MCPHS University.
The race symbolizes overcoming personal challenges, including diabetic ketoacidosis during college, to support T1D research and advocacy.

title: She picked up running at age 45. Now at 61, she’s on track for her Six Star medal.
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Andrea Nwamarah, 61, from Simpsonville, SC, took up running at age 45 after a YMCA class.
She is participating in the Boston Marathon for the MEB Foundation, aiming for her Sixth Star medal.
The MEB Foundation promotes healthy lifestyles and leadership through sports for youth, aligning with Nwamarah's fundraising goals.

title: Boston Marathon runner inspired by aunt’s blindness raises money for the visually impaired
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Paige Stopperich, 29, from Somerville, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon for the Massachusetts Association for the Blind and Visually Impaired.
Inspired by her aunt's vision loss, Stopperich aims to honor her resilience by participating in the marathon.
The Massachusetts Association for the Blind and Visually Impaired provides rehabilitation, mobility training, and support to those with vision loss.

title: Drake Maye says he doesn’t regret marrying young. What readers said.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Drake Maye, 23, of the New England Patriots, appreciates his early marriage to high school sweetheart Anne Michael Maye.
Reader responses varied on early marriage, with some showing long-term success and others viewing it as a mistake.
Examples ranged from 51-year marriages to opinions that early marriage can provide stability or pose significant challenges.

title: Driver accused of killing art collector in Back Bay hit-and-run deemed mentally incompetent
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: William R. Haney Jr. deemed mentally incompetent to stand trial for hit-and-run killing in Back Bay.
Haney pleaded not guilty to murder charges related to the deaths of John Axelrod and his dog on Jan. 3.
Judge returned Haney to Bridgewater State Hospital for further evaluation and treatment to restore competency.

title: Mass. pols decry the SAVE America Act. Will it really disenfranchise voters?
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts politicians criticize the SAVE America Act, citing concerns about voter disenfranchisement due to strict ID requirements.
The act demands citizenship proof, like a passport or birth certificate, potentially affecting millions ahead of midterm elections.
Critics argue the requirements will disproportionately affect women, people of color, seniors, and those with name changes.

title: Mass. woman killed while sunbathing after car drives into residential pool area in Florida
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A Massachusetts woman, Anastasia Fiona Allman, was killed by a Jeep while sunbathing in Fort Pierce, Florida.
The driver, a 38-year-old woman, crashed through hedges and fencing, trapping Allman beneath the vehicle.
Fort Pierce Police suspect a 'medical episode' may have caused the crash; the investigation is ongoing.

title: Review & setlist: Brandi Carlile has tailored her ‘Human Tour’ to humans, beautifully
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Brandi Carlile performed at TD Garden on Feb. 12, 2026, as part of her first arena tour, the 'Human Tour'.
Carlile's setlist included recent songs 'Human' and 'Returning to Myself', and fan-requested 'Downpour' and 'Wherever is Your Heart'.
Governor Maura Healey declared the concert date 'Brandi Carlile Day' in recognition of Carlile's ties to Boston.
